author: Nigel Slater
method: Heat the chicken stock in a saucepan until it is simmering. Add the peas and simmer for 2 minutes, or until just tender. Stir in the tarragon and salt. Transfer the mixture to a food processor and blend for a few short blasts to a rough-textured soup. Return the soup to the saucepan and keep warm over a low heat. Using a pair of tongs, heat each slice of pancetta over the gas flame of your hob for a few seconds until it crisps up. (Alternatively, preheat your grill to its highest setting, lay the slices of pancetta onto a baking tray and grill for 1-2 minutes, or until crisp.) To serve, ladle the soup into bowls. Break the crisp pancetta into pieces and sprinkle on top of the soup.
ingredients: 1 litre/1¾ pints chicken stock,  500g/1lb 2oz frozen peas,  10g/½oz fresh tarragon leaves,  pinch salt,  4 very thin slices pancetta (cut on the thinnest possible setting)
